content:
the Yazoo Land Fraud case had already gone through the court system in Fletcher vs. Peck, and it made it to the supreme court
	john marshall was ready to double the compensation that the farmers had gotten
marshall says that the fraud occurred NOT when the first GA legislature originally sold the land, even though it was unethical, but rather, in the second GA legislature when they tried to resend the original land grant because it was changing the terms of an original contract
the way to deal with fraud was to hold an election (and reelect), but not to change contract terms
he ended up overturning that second GA legislature law

what did Marshall do here? he used judicial review on STATE LAWS, something that had only been used on federal laws
